intro: Dracaena hawaiiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian dracaena, is a species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate light conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
